title: Indian-Style Basmati Rice Recipe
description: Indian rice made with basmati rice, toasted whole spices, and fried onions has a fantastic flavor and makes the perfect side to Indian curry.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Rice Side Dish Recipes Indian Style Basmati Rice 4.7 (369) 252 Reviews 42 Photos Savory Indian rice flavored with toasted and fragrant whole spices and fried onions. Soaking the basmati rice before cooking makes all the difference. Serve with your favorite Indian curry or dal. Make sure you warn people not to bite into the whole spices! Submitted by DHANO923 Updated on April 10, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 42 42 42 42 Cook Time: 35 mins Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 ½ cups basmati rice 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 (2 inch) piece cinnamon stick 2 pods green cardamom 2 whole cloves 1 tablespoon cumin seed 1 small onion, thinly sliced 2 ½ cups water 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place rice into a bowl with enough water to cover. Set aside to soak for 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios In the last 10 minutes of soaking, heat oil in a large pot or saucepan over medium heat. Add cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, and cloves, then stir in cumin seed. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook and stir until fragrant and toasted, about a minute. Add sliced onion and stir. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sauté until the onion is tender and a rich golden brown color, about 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drain water from rice, and stir into the pot. Cook and stir rice until lightly toasted, about 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add water and salt, and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer until all the water has been absorbed, about 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Let stand for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork before serving. Add Your Photo Photos of Indian Style Basmati Rice 01 of 42 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 42 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/24/2025 A keeper! Great flavors 03 of 42 Photo by  lindasb50 04/04/2024 A keeper! This will be my "go to" recipe when having an Indian meal. I followed the recipe fairly closely, using "Royal" Basmati rice. I actually halved the recipe because I am a single. I scraped the Cardamom pods as suggested, used half of the Cumin Seeds, and added some black mustard seeds. So delicious! 04 of 42 Photo by  ProSnap3152 03/23/2023 I have made this recipe 3 times and followed instructions to a tee. I have several co workers from India and they said it reminded them of being back in India..lol.. one coworker said it was better rice than his wife cooks at home . I love this recipe and so do my friends/coworkers from India . Legit Recipe ! 05 of 42 Photo by  bentobox 03/01/2023 Yum! Added a little turmeric for color. 06 of 42 Photo by  Lea deGuzman 05/06/2021 07 of 42 Photo by  ambieb14 02/13/2021 This recipe turned out perfect! I served it with Sri Lankan curry and my family loved it. 08 of 42 Photo by  Helene Wilson 01/03/2021 I used all of the measurements with no subs (maybe extra oil when toasting to keep the rice from sticking). After the toasting step, I finished in the rice cooker. I put enough water to cover the rice without measuring. I love it! I wasn’t sure if it would have flavor, but it does. I plan to make more this week. 09 of 42 Photo by  James 01/01/2021 Great recipe... definitely Indian style.
